meaning_english: Difficult to understand. Synonyms: Obscure, Complex, Vague, Cryptic.
An award or praise. Synonyms: Praise, Honor, Tribute, Recognition.
Bitterness in speech or behavior. Synonyms: Bitterness, Resentment, Hostility, Harshness.
Highly skilled. Synonyms: Proficient, Expert, Skilled, Competent.
Lack of interest or concern. Synonyms: Indifference, Unconcern, Passivity, Detachment.
Aggressive and hostile. Synonyms: Aggressive, Hostile, Combative, Quarrelsome.
Given to sudden changes. Synonyms: Fickle, Unpredictable, Impulsive, Whimsical.
Kept secret. Synonyms: Secret, Hidden, Covert, Concealed.
A difficult problem. Synonyms: Puzzle, Riddle, Dilemma, Enigma.
A complete failure. Synonyms: Failure, Collapse, Disaster, Fiasco.
To mock or ridicule. Synonyms: Mock, Ridicule, Scoff, Taunt.
Hardworking. Synonyms: Industrious, Assiduous, Persistent, Careful.
Outstandingly bad. Synonyms: Shocking, Appalling, Atrocious, Terrible.
Very happy. Synonyms: Joyful, Delighted, Thrilled, Ecstatic.
Something mysterious. Synonyms: Mystery, Puzzle, Riddle, Paradox.
To make worse. Synonyms: Worsen, Aggravate, Intensify, Heighten.
A mistaken belief. Synonyms: Misconception, Error, Illusion, Delusion.
Happening by chance. Synonyms: Accidental, Incidental, Unplanned, Unexpected.
Talkative. Synonyms: Talkative, Loquacious, Verbose, Chatty.
About to happen. Synonyms: Impending, Approaching, Forthcoming, Near.
Flawless. Synonyms: Perfect, Faultless, Spotless, Immaculate.
Continuing without pause. Synonyms: Constant, Unending, Continuous, Relentless.
Very careful. Synonyms: Precise, Thorough, Careful, Exact.
Outdated. Synonyms: Archaic, Outdated, Deprecated, Old-fashioned.
Practical. Synonyms: Practical, Realistic, Sensible, Logical.
Able to recover quickly. Synonyms: Strong, Flexible, Tough, Hardy.
To examine closely. Synonyms: Examine, Inspect, Analyze, Investigate.
False or fake. Synonyms: Fake, False, Fraudulent, Counterfeit.
Persistent. Synonyms: Persistent, Determined, Resolute, Firm.
To clear from blame. Synonyms: Justify, Defend, Exonerate, Acquit.
